reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at Casa Madrona twice, and can highly recommend the hillside suites. We had lived in the area for years before staying here, and somehow got the impression from the outside of the hotel that it might be slightly tacky and run down. I don't know about the other kinds of rooms, but that is definitely not the case where we stayed. This is a "hidden" gem tucked up the side of the hill in Sausalito, and these rooms, while right downtown and convenient to every Sausalito attraction, have a fantastic view of the water with floor to ceiling windows and a balcony. They somehow create a sense of privacy and coziness (romantic!). Though just one large room, they are tastefully appointed, with a large upholstered chaise at the foot of the king bed, another chair and ottoman, two desks, a large bar, and entryway. The room feels light and spacious. The bathroom is sensational, very large with huge tub, double sinks, separate huge glass shower, and a luxurious feel. This hotel doesn't have it's own restaurant but is atop an Italian restaurant Poggio, and they serve room service to the hotel from 7am-10pm which worked great for us! There are a ton of fantastic eateries within walking distance, as well as the bay, the ferry to San Francisco, etc.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience!

reviews.text: I did not use the in-hotel spa this trip but did last time, and can highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Great Place to enjoy the beauty of Sausalito and the Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This boutique hotel has a lovely small lobby with friendly, gracious staff, a separate lounge area with computer and sitting area, and valet parking. I would say the only downside to the hillside rooms is the traffic noise, but that calms completely down at night as Sausalito attracts its action mostly during the day. All in all, for the money and compared to other more pricey hotels in the immediate area, Casa Madrona is a great find, and we will come back every year to our hillside room on the 4th floor!
reviews.title: Great Weekender

reviews.text: We loved Casa Madrona, The room overlooking the bay was really spacious and gracious, the huge tub was fun, the location perfect, and Wendy behind the desk who greeted us and took care of everything we needed was quite wonderful. Would stay here again in a heartbeat. Thanks.
reviews.title: Good choice in Sausalito

reviews.text: Hubby and I stayed here over Thanksgiving weekend. Day one the room was simple elegance but the view was of the fitness center allowing stair climbers to see directly into our room. The accommodating staff moved us to the 4th floor to a corner room with partial views of the Bay and a balcony with seating. Nice upgrade. Staff was friendly and suggested some great local restaurants. Manager also took off a $5 telephone charge since we could not get cell phone coverage in the room or internet access. We will definitely come back again.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel
Gary at the Spa is the Most Gifted .....
reviews.text: We live locally, but we do love the restaurant Poggio both for lunch and dinner. Now, I have a new love....Gary at the spa. My only wish is that I met him sooner! He has been using his healing hands here for 9 years. He is simply amazing. I feel renewed, relaxed, and calm! I have had many massages...none, none, none like this:).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely steam room, shower, lockers and lounge too. Calm, soothing environment.
reviews.title: Over The Bridge

reviews.text: The second stop on our Californian Honeymoon, we opted to leave SF and spend a few days in Sausalito before heading down the coast. Situated in the main building (not one of the hillside cottages) our room was fantastic - with a super comfy bed and wonderful bathroom. On checking in we had some issues with payment (our card was blocked thanks to an overzealous fraud department...) but made our way to the room with a promise to pay later (we did). Sausalito is a gorgeous little town that seems to have been beamed in from classic American movie and there is plenty to keep you occupied for a lazy weekend with easy access to Muir Woods and Angel Island. Sitting on the balcony and looking across the bay was a real treat and we would love to visit again someday.
reviews.title: Super Hotel in Sausalito

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all your in Sausalito so what's not to love! Second, I love how this hotel is set along the mountainside. I stayed here with my daughter in 2008 and had a great experience. The room was beautiful and well maintained. We used the spa facilities and had wonderful treatments there. I would return to this hotel in the future! :)
reviews.title: Great stay in Sausalito

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very impressed with the hillside cottage room that we stayed in. Nice modern remodel, lots of windows and good views. The location of this hotel is part of what makes it so special - right in the middle of Sausalito and an easy walk to everything. Friendly and helpful staff too. Very relaxing stay.
reviews.title: Cozy, loft room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Casa Madrona is just a wonderfully quaint, clean, efficient, modern spot in beautiful and tranquil Sausalito. The hotel sits peacefully on the main waterfront street with beautiful harbor views.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is friendly and willing to please. There is a nice restaurant attached Pagio, which has a nice menu and good selection of wines and very nice f you don't want to venture far. We had lunch here one day and a light breakfast the next. We did not have time for any spa treatments but our room was across the hall from the spa and it did look warm, peaceful and inviting.
reviews.title: For the price I'm paying, I'd expect some integrity.

reviews.text: Would recommend Case Madrona to anyone looking to stay in Saulsalito-(which, by the way, is almost like heaven on earth).
reviews.title: Fabulous location, relaxing stay!

reviews.title: Impeccable service, gorgeous views!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got the hillside cottage balcony room, and the interior was very modern, clean, and spacious. The bed was very comfortable and we purchased a bubble bath and salt set for a relaxing time in the extra wide and deep tub. We had a balcony with an awesome view of the marina. Since the balconies aren't layered above each other, you can look straight up and get a spectacular view of the night sky.
reviews.title: Comfortable with Nice Views of the

reviews.text: A very nice boutique hotel. It's small, but well done and perfect for a quick getaway for 2. Lots of great dining within in walking distance. Steps from ferry. Great for romance- probably a bore for kids.
reviews.title: Beautiful views, amazing staff and lovely rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to the Casa Madrona for a little mid-week getaway and it was even better than expected. Since the hotel was fully booked they upgraded us to a "cottage" room. We had a fireplace and a lovely view of the harbor. It's fun to be in Sausalito in the off season when things are quiet and not crowded. The hotel restaurant, Poggio, is excellent--a little piece of Italy. I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful service and view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I came here with high expectations only to have them dashed almost immediately - my deluxe hillside cottage balcony suite had a balcony that was so small, that I was shocked. Also, upon calling the front desk, I was told that I could not be moved because the upper levels were under construction and it would be even noisier than it was on the 3rd floor. Further, the bathroom was smaller than one I recently had on a cruise ship. The shower was small compared to one you would expect at a luxury hotel. I chose this hotel over Inn Above Tide and Cavallo Point; I will not make that mistake again.
reviews.title: I won't be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a bed and breakfast package, which was a bit misleading. The breakfast was basically a limited continental breakfast and although I was told at check-in that we could use the coupon for room service, we were told later that this was not the case.
reviews.title: Great views, less great amenities

reviews.text: If you have a chance, go somewhere else.
